page.title: 11AN OLD PEOPLE'S HOME
page.content: The'Lawns'was built in 1963.It caters for old people whose family cannot look after them.It is paid for by the local authority,with extras paid for by fund _raising events like sponsored walks. There are about 6O permanent residents plus a few day_care people,who live on their own but need special attention with things like bathing. The residents like the freedom to come and go.They receive visitors whenever they wish and go out as long as the warden knows about this. There are some complaints about the food but generally they feel that individual likes and dislikes are well catered for.Basket weaving is done by the residents as a therapy,card and board games are played and T.V. is watched.
